subject: Re: Order #SSN3633, how did it go?
description_text:
I'm a little bit dissatisfied, I can't use them yet because they have got EMI and they interfere with my pedals inputs

Inviato da Outlook per Android<https://aka.ms/AAb9ysg>
________________________________
From: SIMSONN <no-reply@loox.io>
Sent: Wednesday, December 10, 2025 12:49:00 PM
To: alerotavirus@hotmail.com <alerotavirus@hotmail.com>
Subject: Order #SSN3633, how did it go?

Hello Alessandro, We would be grateful if you shared how things look and feel. Your review helps us and the community that supports us, and it only takes a few seconds. ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

conversations.body_text: Hi Alessandro Rota,  If this happens, it indicates that the computer’s grounding is not reliable, possibly because a three-prong plug was not used with a three-prong wall outlet. You can refer to the post below: connect the computer case to the stand, and connect the control box to the metal screws on the pedals. This should resolve the disconnection issue.  https://github.com/SHWotever/SimHub/wiki/USB-Issues-Troubleshooting https://support.gomezsimindustries.com/portal/en/kb/articles/understanding-emi-and-grounding     Additionally, you can use the provided nylon screws and nylon washers to install the VAM Pro motor, electrically isolating the motor from the bracket. This way, it will not affect the input signals.
